description: Kubernetes Overview Dashboard highlighting cluster capacity

panels.description: This aggregates all available CPU cores and what is currently allocated. If this graph it's 100% no more pods will be able to start because no more CPU requests are available. We have purposely adjusted this by 112% and not 100% to give you some breathing room.
panels.title: Real Time Request CPU on Compute Nodes

panels.description: This aggregates all available CPU cores and CPU usage of the entire cluster. If this hits 80-100% the entire cluster will suffer from poor performance.
panels.title: Real time CPU Usage on Compute Nodes

panels.description: The sum of all the CPU Requests of all the Quotas. This will give you an indication if your cluster is over subscribed with CPU request for all the projects. If all the namespaces were to ask for promised qutoas, and this graph is over 100%, the cluster would not be able to fulfill the request.
panels.title: Total CPU Request of all Project Quotas

panels.description: This aggregates all available CPU cores and what is currently allocated. If this graph it's 100% no more pods will be able to start because no more CPU requests are available. We have purposely adjusted this by 112% and not 100% to give you some breathing room.
panels.title: Real Time Memory Requests on Compute Nodes

panels.description: This aggregates all available Memory on compute nodes and displays Used Memory. Once this hits 100% pods will start dying from Out Of Memory (OOM) errors
panels.title: Real time Memory  Usage on Compute Nodes

panels.description: The sum of all the Memory Requests of all the Quotas. This will give you an indication if your cluster is over subscribed with Memory request for all the projects. If all the namespaces were to ask for promised qutoas, and this graph is over 100%, the cluster would not be able to fulfill the request.
panels.title: Total Memory Request of all Project Quotas

panels.description: The maximum number of pods you can run on the system
panels.title: Pod Limit (20 pods per core)
CPU Utilization per Node over Time
Memory Usage per Node over Time

panels.description: Percentage total CPUs are overloaded, i.e. the percentage of time processes were waiting for CPU.
panels.title: Normalised Server Load over 15 Minutes

panels.description: Per disk utilization across all instances
panels.title: Per disk utilization > 20% IO

alert.name: Filesystem Utilization for Nodes and PVCs

panels.title: Filesystem Utilization for Nodes and PVCs over 70%
Total time duration the container has been throttled

alert.message: VMware Node is close to maximum disk allocation
alert.name: Number of Block Device per Node

panels.description: VMware has a limit  of 64 block devices it can attach to a VM. This metric is important because Kubernetes can schedule a pod onto a node that cannot attach any more disk.
panels.title: Number of Block Device per Node

title: Kubernetes Overview
